synopsis.text:
She et metal apprentice and budding shoe designer, Takao Akizuki, finds solace in the rain and the inspiration it brings to his artistic endeavors. One fateful rainy morning in Tokyo, Takao chooses to forgo his classes and sketch in a serene Japanese garden, where he encounters the enigmatic Yukari Yukino, an older woman seemingly lost in life.

As the rainy season progresses, Takao and Yukari continue to cross paths in the garden, forging an unlikely bond that transcends their age difference. The pair finds comfort and understanding in each other's company, opening up about their dreams and personal struggles. As the end of the rainy season looms, the two must confront their deepening feelings and the challenges that lie ahead.

In the lush garden that serves as their sanctuary, Takao and Yukari's poignant tale unfolds, exploring the delicate balance between love, self-discovery, and the transient nature of time. Will the fleeting rainy season provide them with enough time to express their true feelings and overcome their personal obstacles? Only time will tell in "The Garden of Words."
